trans-unit.target: TEXT_LUCKZI202_03561_SEQ_00<tab><var 48 F201FC /var><var 49 F201FD /var> Quest Sync<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Xorutt is short and bearded and ready to brew.
TEXT_LUCKZI202_03561_TODO_00<tab>Find clumps of magma grass and collect magma blooms.
TEXT_LUCKZI202_03561_TODO_01<tab>Deliver the magma blooms to Xorutt.

TEXT_LUCKZI202_03561_XORUTT_000_000<tab>Lali-ho! Say, ain't you that <var 09 E948 ((traveler)) ((traveler)) ((foreign dwarf)) ((traveler)) ((traveler)) ((traveler)) ((traveler)) ((traveler)) /var> everyone's been talking about?
TEXT_LUCKZI202_03561_XORUTT_000_001<tab>Well, lali-ho again and welcome to Tomra! I'm going to treat you to some Tholl hospitality, and I'll not take no for an answer!
TEXT_LUCKZI202_03561_XORUTT_000_002<tab>First things first: we brew some dwarven ale together! Aye, that'll be a lark!
TEXT_LUCKZI202_03561_XORUTT_000_003<tab>Now, most folk make their ale from barley, but not us dwarves. We use seeds harvested from the magma grass what grows on the slopes of Mt. Gulg.

TEXT_LUCKZI202_03561_XORUTT_000_004<tab>Them weeds drink in the sea air from the moment their heads poke out of the dirt to the moment they wilt and die. Gives our grog a tangy flavor you won't never taste in any of that barley-brewed stuff!

TEXT_LUCKZI202_03561_XORUTT_000_005<tab>So! Let's give you the full experience, shall we? Head on out of the village, and pluck me four or so good-sized magma blooms─they're crammed tight with seeds, don't you know!
TEXT_LUCKZI202_03561_XORUTT_000_006<tab>...What do magma blooms look like? Well, they're tall and orange and probably a bit sparkly. You'll know when you see 'em.
TEXT_LUCKZI202_03561_XORUTT_000_010<tab>Well? Did you pluck them blooms like I asked you? Brewing time's a-wasting!

TEXT_LUCKZI202_03561_XORUTT_000_011<tab>Aye, that's enough seeds to stuff my helm and then some! Good work! This next part of the process is a bit tricky, so let's leave that to an expert. Which would be me.
TEXT_LUCKZI202_03561_XORUTT_000_012<tab>But don't wander away just yet, my friend! There's more to our traditions than just picking sparkly flowers, and we're just getting started!
